fine_dining.name: Speilsalen
signature_dishes: Seasonal tasting menu focusing on premium Norwegian ingredients
fine_dining.atmosphere: Grand, elegant hall of mirrors within Britannia Hotel; luxurious and formal
fine_dining.booking_tips: Book well in advance, especially for weekends; located in the prestigious Britannia Hotel
fine_dining.local_tips: Led by Bocuse d'Or silver medalist Christopher Davidsen. Offers a highly refined experience with exceptional service and stunning presentations. Champagne brunch on Saturdays is also popular.

fine_dining.name: Fagn
signature_dishes: Tasting menus (large and small) with local Trøndelag ingredients
fine_dining.atmosphere: Two levels: Fine dining downstairs (intimate, focused), Bistro/bar upstairs (relaxed, casual)
fine_dining.booking_tips: Book fine dining in advance; bistro is more casual but booking still recommended. Offers specific 'Wednesday at Fagn' concept menu.
fine_dining.local_tips: One of Trondheim's first Michelin-starred restaurants. Chef Jonas Andre Nåvik (ex-Alinea). Offers both high-end and more accessible dining experiences under one roof.

fine_dining.name: Credo
signature_dishes: Extensive tasting menu focused on hyperlocal, sustainable, and organic ingredients
Dishes built around produce from their own farm and local collaborators
Emphasis on nose-to-tail and root-to-leaf philosophy
Milk ice cream from their own cows
fine_dining.atmosphere: Modern, spacious, located in a renovated industrial building in Lilleby; focus on natural materials
fine_dining.booking_tips: Book several months in advance. Known for its strong sustainability focus (Green Michelin Star). Offers a journey-like dining experience.
fine_dining.local_tips: Chef Heidi Bjerkan is a pioneer in Norwegian sustainable gastronomy. The experience often starts with snacks in a mezzanine area before moving to the main dining room. Closed as of late 2024, check for updates.

casual_dining.name: Kraft Bodega
signature_dishes: Scallop tartare with som tam sauce
Steamed cabbage with butter sauce and caviar
Chicken skin crackers with crab meat & hot sauces
Seasonal tasting menus (small/large) and à la carte
casual_dining.atmosphere: Industrial-chic in the harbor area (Brattørkaia); vibrant, informal, blue chairs
casual_dining.booking_tips: Exciting flavors with international influences. Good for sharing. Offers both tasting menus and à la carte flexibility.
casual_dining.local_tips: Chef Thomas Borgan offers bold, punchy flavors in a fun, dynamic setting. Known for creative dishes and challenging spice levels.

casual_dining.name: Spontan Vinbar
signature_dishes: Norwegian langoustine with fried yeast emulsion
casual_dining.atmosphere: Cozy, modern wine bar vibe in the front; dedicated restaurant section in the back
casual_dining.booking_tips: Excellent natural wine selection. Can visit just for wine and snacks or book for the full tasting menu.
casual_dining.local_tips: Chef Fredrik Engen focuses on local, seasonal ingredients paired with excellent sauces. Great spot for natural wine lovers.

casual_dining.name: Bula Neobistro
casual_dining.atmosphere: Eclectic, stylish, playful; reflects chef's personality
casual_dining.booking_tips: Menu is often a surprise. Expect creative, sometimes whimsical dishes blending high-end techniques with comfort food concepts.
casual_dining.local_tips: Chef Reneé Fagerhøi brings a unique vision, turning childhood food dreams and fast food concepts into refined dishes. Fun and unpredictable.

casual_dining.name: To Rom & Kjøkken
signature_dishes: Seasonal dishes with local Trøndelag ingredients
casual_dining.atmosphere: Classic, elegant European restaurant feel; warm and service-oriented
casual_dining.booking_tips: Established Trondheim institution since 2005. Focuses on classic techniques and high-quality local ingredients.
casual_dining.local_tips: Proprietor Roar Hildonen is a key figure in Trondheim's food scene. Expect well-executed classics rather than experimental cuisine.

casual_dining.name: Baklandet Skydsstation
casual_dining.atmosphere: Extremely cozy, historic, eclectic decor; feels like visiting a grandmother's house
casual_dining.booking_tips: Located in a charming old wooden house in Bakklandet. Very popular, can get crowded.
casual_dining.local_tips: A unique Trondheim experience offering authentic Norwegian home-style food in a very atmospheric setting. Great for 'koselig' (cozy) vibes.

casual_dining.name: Una Pizzeria e Bar
casual_dining.atmosphere: Modern, rustic, lively; open kitchen view; popular and often busy
casual_dining.booking_tips: Located in the popular Solsiden area. Good for groups. Consistent quality.
casual_dining.local_tips: One of Trondheim's most popular pizza places, known for authentic Italian pizza.

street_food.name: Super Hero Burger
specialties: Truffle burger, Blue cheese burger, Classic burger
street_food.local_tips: Known for high-quality burgers with a smoky flavor from the Josper grill. A very popular late-night food spot.

street_food.name: Koie Ramen
street_food.local_tips: Sister restaurant to the popular Oslo spot. Offers authentic Japanese ramen with house-made components. Karaage is a must-try side.

street_food.name: Gola Empanadas & Gelato
specialties: Argentinian Empanadas (various fillings, e.g., cheese & onion)
Handmade Italian-style Gelato (e.g., Vanilla with citrus zest, Dulce de Leche)
street_food.local_tips: Hole-in-the-wall spot perfect for a quick, delicious lunch or sweet treat. Run by friendly Argentinian owners.

coffee_shops.name: Jacobsen & Svart
coffee_shops.atmosphere: Minimalist, quality-focused, located in the 'Architects' House'
coffee_shops.local_tips: Widely regarded as Trondheim's best specialty coffee bar, run by award-winning barista Tony Jacobsen. Focus is on high-quality coffee.

coffee_shops.name: Sellanraa Bok & Bar
coffee_shops.atmosphere: Cozy, bright, literary vibe combined with excellent food and coffee
coffee_shops.local_tips: High-quality food that often exceeds typical cafe standards. Great spot for brunch or lunch. Also has a connected bakery, Isak Brød & Bar.

coffee_shops.name: Dromedar Kaffebar
must_try: Søt Chili Kaffe (Sweet Chili Coffee - signature drink)
coffee_shops.atmosphere: Varies by location, often cozy and popular with students/locals; Bakklandet location is particularly charming
coffee_shops.local_tips: Trondheim's original specialty coffee bar chain (since late 90s). Multiple locations. Known for their unique Sweet Chili Coffee.

coffee_shops.name: Hevd Håndverksbakeri
coffee_shops.atmosphere: Modern, quality bakery feel; Søndre location is central
coffee_shops.food_options: Excellent bread, pastries, breakfast & lunch dishes
coffee_shops.local_tips: Run by a former Norwegian baking champion. Focus on high-quality bread and baked goods, also offers cafe menu items.

bars.name: Raus Bar
bars.atmosphere: Stylish, sophisticated yet welcoming; leather seating, good music
bars.local_tips: Considered Trondheim's best cocktail bar, run by award-winning bartender Jørgen Dons. Knowledgeable staff.

bars.name: Spontan Vinbar (Bar section)
signature_drinks: Extensive, curated natural wine list by the glass and bottle
bars.atmosphere: Modern, cozy, relaxed wine bar atmosphere
bars.food_options: Excellent bar snacks (charcuterie, cheese, small plates from kitchen)
bars.local_tips: Top destination for natural wine enthusiasts in Trondheim. You can enjoy snacks or small plates alongside your wine.

bars.name: E.C. Dahls Pub og Kjøkken
signature_drinks: Wide selection of guest taps (local and international)
bars.atmosphere: Large, industrial-style pub connected to the historic E.C. Dahls brewery; lively
bars.local_tips: Offers brewery tours and tastings. Great place to sample local Trondheim beer and international craft beers. Good food options too.

bars.name: ØX Tap Room
signature_drinks: Rotating taps of other Norwegian craft beers
bars.atmosphere: Modern tap room located in the basement of Frati restaurant; focus on beer
bars.food_options: Can order food from Frati upstairs
bars.local_tips: Good spot to try beers from the local ØX brewery. Connected to Frati restaurant for food options.

food_tours.name: Trondheim Food Tours (General)
highlights: Guided walking tours combining food tastings with city sightseeing
Sampling local specialties (seafood, cheese, meats, baked goods)
Visiting local markets or specialty shops
Learning about Trondheim's culinary history and status as European Region of Gastronomy 2022
food_tours.booking_tips: Several local companies offer food tours; search for current providers like 'Trondheim Tours' or check with the Tourist Information. Book in advance. Wear comfortable shoes.

cooking_classes.name: Trøndelag Culinary Courses (General)
what_you_learn: Focus on seasonal produce from the Trøndelag region
cooking_classes.booking_tips: Fewer dedicated public cooking schools than larger cities. Check options through venues like Britannia Hotel, some restaurants (e.g., Fagn occasionally offers courses), or community centers. Courses may be more sporadic; booking essential.

markets.name: Trondheim Torg (Market Square)
highlights: Central city square hosting occasional farmers' markets and food festivals (especially summer/autumn)
Opportunity to buy local produce directly from farmers
markets.hours: Market days vary (check local event calendars)
markets.local_tips: Not a permanent daily food market like Mathallen in Oslo, but hosts events like the Trøndersk Food Festival (usually August). Check local listings for specific market dates.

markets.name: Ravnkloa Fish Market
highlights: Historic small fish market by the canal
Departure point for Munkholmen boat trips
markets.hours: Daytime, check locally as hours can vary
markets.local_tips: Small, traditional fish market. Good place to buy fresh shrimp ('ferske reker') in summer. More limited selection than large dedicated fish markets.

spring: Skrei (Arctic Cod) - end of season in early spring
Fresh Asparagus from Frosta ('Trondheim's kitchen garden')
summer: Strawberries and other berries from local farms
autumn: Fårikål (Lamb and Cabbage Stew) - National dish, late September
